page.title: 18Conservation
page.content: Cowbridge is situated within a conservation area with over fifty buildings in the town listed as being of architectural or historical interest. Their present day character largely derives from 18th century prosperity and the subsequent slow pace of change after 1850 when the town was by-passed by the Cardiff to Swansea railway. The "spirit of conservation" was behind the renovation of Old Hall from a derelict state a few years ago to provide an excellent new library, clinic and centre for adult education. The key areas for conservation includes the walled town, Eastgate and parts of Westgate, the old village of Llanblethian and the castle. The pattern of narrow walled lanes in the Llanblethian area will be maintained. {Jayne Basey
